Overview
Beneficial Ownership Information Report

Effective January 1st, 2024 most companies are required to report their beneficial owner to the U.S. Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN). This means you must identify and document any person who holds a 25% or greater ownership interest or exercises substantial control over a company.

The BOI report filing, due on March 21, 2025 (passed as of March 25, 2025; no penalties enforced) and FinCEN has stated that the filing date is firm. Currently, no penalties are being enforced for missing the March 21, 2025, deadline, per FinCEN's announcement.

Due to ongoing litigation, future deadlines may change; check FinCEN updates for the latest information.

Act now! File your BOIReport today.
How BOI Reporting Works

We help you get complaint and stay compliant

Step 1 - Enter Your
Company's Information

BOI Reporting provides a user-friendly interface with tips, commentary, and round the clock customer support to help you input the required information about your Company, Company Applicants and Beneficial Owners.



Step 2 - File Your Beneficial
Ownership Information Report

Reports are submitted directly to FinCEN electronically through an automated process, using cutting-edge technology that makes your filing fast, safe, and efficient. BOI Reporting does not store or sell your sensitive data.

Step 3 - Receive Confirmation
and Reminders

We will provide you with the FinCEN confirmation number for your records. After your filing is confirmed, BOI Reporting will periodically send you updates and reminders to help you stay compliant.
